title: Al Alvarez, poet and critic who relished high-risk pursuits and wrote acclaimed books on poker, mountaineering and suicide – obituary
text:
Al Alvarez, who has died aged 90, was a critic, poet and novelist; he also wrote books about poker and mountaineering, at both of which he enjoyed some success, and about suicide, at which he did not.

As his non-literary interests suggest, danger was important to Alvarez. He described himself as “an adrenalin junkie”, an inclination that manifested itself in his boyhood. Born with an abnormality in one leg which necessitated operations and a lead boot, he “was a fragile child,” he recalled. “So I made a point of ceasing to be one. I took up mountain-climbing, rugby and boxing.” He broke his nose at boxing and an ankle while mountaineering.

This tendency also marked his approach to literature....
